page.title: 10Bridges at Haltwhistle.
page.content: There are three bridges across the River Tyne: The{Alston Arches}is a viaduct. This was used to carry the railway from Haltwhistle to Alston. The line is not used now. There are 4 arches on the weir and one arch on either side. Four of the large pillars have an arch shaped space that was going to be used to build a footbridge. The{old bridge}was built in 1875 so that people who lived on the other side of the river could get to the railway station. This bridge was not built for heavy lorries so bollards were put at each end to stop the traffic using it. The County Council built a{new {bridge}at the West End so that people in Plenmeller have to come a lot further to get into Haltwhistle. There is only room for one line of traffic.
